Sion: The Undead Juggernaut

Release Date: September 21, 2009

Sion, the Undead Juggernaut, is a fearsome champion in the popular online game League of Legends. With his imposing presence and relentless strength, Sion has become a force to be reckoned with on the battlefield. In this article, we will delve into Sion's story, his strengths and weaknesses, his background in the game, and his significant role in the League of Legends universe.

The Story of Sion

Sion's tale is one of tragedy and resurrection. Once a proud Noxian warrior, Sion met his demise on the battlefield. However, his undying loyalty to Noxus caught the attention of the infamous necromancer, Mordekaiser. Mordekaiser resurrected Sion as an undead abomination, binding his soul to a new, monstrous body.

Now driven solely by his insatiable bloodlust, Sion serves as a relentless war machine for Noxus. He rampages through the battlefield, crushing his enemies with his massive axe and unstoppable strength. Sion's existence is a testament to the dark and twisted nature of Noxian power.

Strengths and Weaknesses

Sion possesses a unique set of strengths and weaknesses that make him a formidable champion in the game. His primary strength lies in his incredible durability and crowd control abilities. With his passive ability,

Sion can continue fighting even after being killed, allowing him to potentially turn the tide of a battle.

Furthermore, Sion's
ability allows him to unleash a devastating blow, damaging and slowing enemies in a wide area. His

ability enables him to knock back and damage enemies in a line, providing excellent crowd control and initiation potential.

However, Sion does have his weaknesses. His lack of mobility makes him vulnerable to champions who can kite him or avoid his attacks. Additionally, his abilities have long cooldowns, making proper ability management crucial for maximizing his effectiveness in fights. Skilled opponents who can dodge or mitigate his crowd control can also pose a significant challenge to Sion.

Sion's Background in the Game

Sion has been a part of League of Legends since its early days, having been released on September 21, 2009. Over the years, Sion has undergone several reworks and updates to improve his gameplay and visual design. These changes have made him a more engaging and versatile champion, appealing to a wider range of players.

As a champion, Sion is primarily played in the top lane or as a tanky jungler. His ability to soak up damage and initiate team fights makes him a valuable asset to any team composition. Sion's presence in the game has been felt in both casual and professional play, with players utilizing his strengths to secure victories and dominate their opponents.

Sion's Place in the Game

Sion holds a significant place in the League of Legends universe, both in terms of lore and gameplay. Lore-wise, Sion represents the dark and brutal nature of Noxus, showcasing the lengths to which the empire will go to achieve victory. His story adds depth and complexity to the game's narrative, intertwining with other champions and events in the vast League of Legends lore.

In terms of gameplay, Sion's role as a tank and initiator makes him a crucial component of many team compositions. His ability to absorb damage and disrupt the enemy team allows his allies to follow up and secure kills. Sion's presence in team fights can turn the tide of battle, making him a highly sought-after pick in competitive play.

On our website, you can find detailed information and videos showcasing all of Sion's skins. Whether you prefer the classic Undead Juggernaut look or want to explore his alternate appearances, our page provides a comprehensive overview of Sion's cosmetic options.

In conclusion, Sion is a formidable champion in League of Legends, embodying the raw power and brutality of Noxus. With his tragic backstory, unique abilities, and significant role in the game, Sion has become a fan-favorite and a staple pick for those seeking to dominate the battlefield. Whether you're a seasoned player or new to the game, Sion's undying strength and relentless pursuit of victory make him a force to be reckoned with.

Sion (Hextech Sion)

RP Cost: 1350 RP

Release Date: November 10, 2016

Sion, the Undead Juggernaut, is a fearsome champion in the popular online game League of Legends. With his massive size and brute strength, Sion is a force to be reckoned with on the battlefield. Over the years, Sion has received various skins that allow players to customize his appearance and add a unique touch to their gameplay experience. One such skin is the

skin, which was released on November 10, 2016, and can be purchased for 1350 RP.

The Hextech Sion skin takes the already intimidating Sion and gives him a futuristic, mechanical makeover. This skin transforms Sion into a hulking, robotic monstrosity, complete with glowing blue eyes and intricate hextech armor. The attention to detail in this skin is truly remarkable, with every aspect of Sion's appearance reflecting the technological theme. From the gears and pistons in his limbs to the glowing energy coursing through his body, Hextech Sion is a sight to behold.

Not only does the Hextech Sion skin change Sion's appearance, but it also alters his abilities and animations. When using his abilities, Sion unleashes a barrage of hextech-infused attacks, causing explosions and leaving a trail of energy in his wake. His ultimate ability, Unstoppable Onslaught, sees Sion charging forward with even more force, leaving a trail of destruction in his path. The animations for his basic attacks and abilities are smooth and satisfying, making playing as Hextech Sion a truly enjoyable experience.

Now, let's delve into the story of Sion and his place in the League of Legends universe. Sion was once a proud Noxian warrior, known for his unmatched strength and unwavering loyalty to his nation. However, during a crucial battle, Sion fell in combat and was presumed dead. But death did not mark the end for Sion. Through dark magic and necromancy, he was resurrected as an undead abomination, his body pieced together with scraps of flesh and metal.

Now a mindless killing machine, Sion serves as a weapon for Noxus, wreaking havoc on the battlefield and striking fear into the hearts of his enemies. His immense strength allows him to cleave through multiple foes with a single swing of his massive axe, while his passive ability, Glory in Death, grants him a second chance to continue fighting even after being brought down.

Despite his terrifying appearance and brutal nature, Sion does have weaknesses. His lack of mobility makes him vulnerable to crowd control effects, and his reliance on melee attacks puts him at a disadvantage against ranged champions. Additionally, Sion's abilities have long cooldowns, requiring careful timing and strategic decision-making to maximize their effectiveness.

In the game, Sion is primarily played as a top laner or a tank in the jungle. His role is to initiate team fights, soak up damage, and disrupt the enemy team. With his crowd control abilities and high durability, Sion excels at engaging the enemy team and protecting his own allies. His ultimate ability, Unstoppable Onslaught, allows him to charge into the heart of the enemy team, knocking up and damaging anyone in his path.

Overall, Sion is a formidable champion with a rich backstory and a unique playstyle. Whether you prefer the classic Sion or the futuristic Hextech Sion, there is no denying the impact this undead juggernaut can have on the battlefield. If you're interested in learning more about Sion and his various appearances, be sure to check out the videos and information available on this page.

Remember, the League of Legends universe is vast and filled with diverse champions, each with their own stories and abilities. Exploring the lore and gameplay of different champions is a great way to enhance your gaming experience and discover new strategies. So, dive into the world of League of Legends and unleash your inner summoner!

Despite his mindless state, Sion's past as a Noxian soldier still lingers within him. He carries the memories of his fallen comrades and the glory of battle, driving him to seek out new foes to conquer. Sion's ultimate goal is to prove his worth to Noxus and reclaim his lost honor.

His passive ability, Glory in Death, allows him to continue fighting even after being killed, granting him a chance to take down his enemies in a final act of defiance. His Q ability, Decimating Smash, smashes the ground, damaging and slowing enemies in a line. His W ability, Soul Furnace, grants him a shield and increases his health when activated, providing additional survivability. His E ability, Roar of the Slayer, sends out a shockwave that damages and slows enemies hit. Finally, his ultimate ability, Unstoppable Onslaught, allows him to charge forward, knocking aside enemies and dealing massive damage upon impact.

Sion's strengths lie in his ability to soak up damage and initiate team fights. With his crowd control abilities and high base health, he can disrupt the enemy team and create opportunities for his allies to follow up. However, Sion's lack of mobility and reliance on landing skill shots make him vulnerable to champions with high mobility or long-range poke.

Overall, Sion is a powerful and iconic champion in the League of Legends universe. His tragic backstory and undying determination make him a compelling character to play and explore. Whether you choose to pilot the colossal Mecha Zero Sion or embrace the raw power of the Undead Juggernaut, Sion offers a unique and thrilling gameplay experience.

The Story of Sion

Sion, once a proud Noxian warrior, met a tragic end on the battlefield. However, his story did not end there. Through dark magic and necromancy, Sion was resurrected as an undead juggernaut, bound to serve Noxus once again. Now, he seeks only one thing: destruction.

In the game, Sion is a tanky champion with a focus on crowd control and disruption. His passive ability, Glory in Death, allows him to continue fighting even after he falls in battle, giving him a chance to wreak havoc on his enemies. Sion's Q ability, Decimating Smash, allows him to slam his axe into the ground, damaging and slowing enemies in a line. His W ability, Soul Furnace, grants him a shield and increases his damage when activated. Sion's E ability, Roar of the Slayer, sends out a shockwave that damages and slows enemies hit. Finally, his ultimate ability, Unstoppable Onslaught, allows him to charge forward, knocking up and damaging enemies in his path.

Sion's strengths lie in his ability to initiate team fights and soak up damage for his team. With his crowd control abilities and tankiness, he can disrupt the enemy team and create opportunities for his allies to follow up. However, Sion's weaknesses include his lack of mobility and susceptibility to kiting. Without proper positioning and coordination with his team, Sion can be easily kited and rendered ineffective.
